title: Photographer Ben 'Von' Wong used 168,000 used/discarded plastic straws ...
body: Photographer Ben 'Von' Wong used 168,000 used/discarded plastic straws to create #strawpocalypse to highlight plastic pollution Archived post. New comments cannot be posted and votes cannot be cast. ... 😂 😂 😂 No mate, he could have bought 100,000 straws for $10 but instead himself, Starbucks Vietnam and volunteers spent 6 months ...
readable_content:
- theskyguyuk (2020-09-30): Photographer Ben 'Von' Wong used 168,000 used/discarded plastic straws to create #strawpocalypse to highlight plastic pollution
- hagrid2018 (2020-09-30): Then he threw them back into the bin?
    - TravelZac (2020-09-30): That looks like more than 168,000
- AutoModerator (2020-09-30): Moderator Announcement Read More »
- Nytfa11 (2020-09-30): Sooooo....he bought almost 200,000 straws to protest too many straws? How does that help AT ALL !?
summary:
The sentiment of the conversation about banning plastic straws is somewhat negative, with some users questioning the effectiveness of using a large number of straws for a protest against plastic pollution. They appear to be skeptical about the impact of such a display. 

Sentiment: -0.5
